src:
Casado asegura que el PP tiene las "mismas opciones" de gobernar que Sánchez
Afirma desde Lalín que su partido porque puede "dialogar, negociar y pactar" como ha hecho a nivel autonómico y local
02 Nov 2019, 06:40 by LALÍN. EFE   
El líder del PP, Pablo Casado, ha asegurado este sábado que tiene "las mismas opciones para gobernar" que el presidente del Gobierno en funciones y candidato socialista, Pedro Sánchez, porque puede "dialogar, negociar y pactar" como ha hecho a nivel autonómico y local.En un mitin-comida en Lalín, con unos 1.500 asistentes, según la organización, ha considerado que ya está en "empate técnico" con los socialistas para el 10N por lo que ha reclamado a su partido un "impulso final" para ganar las elecciones, algo que ve posible si se consigue "unir los esfuerzos" de todo el centro derecha.Casado se ha situado como la única opción, entre los cinco líderes de los principales partidos que estarán en el debate electoral del lunes, que garantiza la "alternancia" frente a un Sánchez que no ha querido pactar desde abril y que ha planteado las elecciones como un "autorreferéndum".Por eso, ha instado a unir la "inmensa mayoría que ama España" en torno al PP y convencer a los indecisos de que votando esta opción van a ver defendidos sus intereses "sin sectarismos, sin intolerancia y con fiabilidad", a diferencia de otros partidos, aunque en ningún momento ha citado a Ciudadanos y Vox.Y es que su críticas han vuelto a estar centradas en Sánchez a quien ha reprochado que vaya a "forzar" a los reyes de España "a visitar la dictadura cubana un día después de las elecciones", algo de "verdadera vergüenza", ha dicho.También le produce esta misma vergüenza que Estados Unidos "se está planteando sancionar a España por sus contemporizaciones con el régimen dictatorial de Nicolás Maduro", según ha afirmado, pese a que el Gobierno ha insistido hoy mismo en que la Administración estadounidense "nunca ha barajado" esa idea.Pero Casado ha abundado en esta posibilidad y ha considerado que, con el actual Gobierno, el país ha dejado de ser el "faro de libertad" para Iberoamérica, por lo que le ha pedido a Sánchez "un poco de respeto por la historia de España".Su lista de reproches al candidato socialista se ha iniciado al echarle en cara que sienta "desprecio" por Galicia, una tierra que Casado ha elegido para realizar el "mitin central" de esta campaña, según él mismo ha dicho, precisamente por este motivo, porque los socialistas "no ganan" en esta comunidad.Sin embargo, el PSOE ganó por primera vez en Galicia en las pasadas elecciones de abril, en las que el PP se quedó detrás con nueve escaños. Ahora, el partido espera recupera el 10N la primera posición con un diputado más Pontevedra, otro por A Coruña e incluso uno por Ourense, para volver a los 12 que tenían antes.En clave gallega, Casado ha comprometido la llegada del AVE a Galicia para el Xacobeo de 2021 y también con el futuro del sector naval y con la industria electrointensiva, frente a un Gobierno que cree que no hace nada por esta comunidad.Casado ha sido precedido en este acto por el presidente de la Xunta, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, quien ha mandado un mensaje claro a los votantes de Ciudadanos y de Vox, a los que ha advertido de que cada voto para estos partidos solo servirá para dar el Gobierno a Sánchez, que lo que pretende es "dividir" a los votantes.
text:
Casado says the PP has the "same options" to govern as Sánchez
He affirms from Lalín that his party because he can "dialogue, negotiate and agree" as he has done at the regional and local level
02 Nov 2019, 06:40 by LALÍN. EFE
The leader of the PP, Pablo Casado, said on Saturday that he has "the same options to govern" as the president of the government in office and socialist candidate, Pedro Sánchez, because he can "dialogue, negotiate and agree" as he has done at the regional level and local. At a rally-meal in Lalín, with about 1,500 attendees, according to the organization, he has considered that he is already in a "technical tie" with the Socialists for the 10N, so he has claimed a "final impulse" for winning the elections, something that he sees possible if he manages to "unite the efforts" of the entire right-wing center. Married, he has positioned himself as the only option, among the five leaders of the main parties that will be in the electoral debate on Monday, which guarantees the "alternation" against a Sánchez who has not wanted to agree since April and who has raised the elections as a "self-referendum." Therefore, he has urged to unite the "vast majority who love Spain" around the PP and convince the indeci The fact that, by voting on this option, they are going to see their interests defended "without sectarianism, without intolerance and with reliability", unlike other parties, although at no time have they quoted Citizens and Vox. And their criticism has again focused in Sanchez to whom he has reproached that he is going to "force" the kings of Spain "to visit the Cuban dictatorship one day after the elections," something of "real shame," he said. It also produces this same shame as the United States. "It is considering sanctioning Spain for its contemplations with the dictatorial regime of Nicolás Maduro," he said, despite the fact that the Government has insisted today that the US Administration "has never considered" that idea. But Married has abounded in This possibility and has considered that, with the current Government, the country has ceased to be the "beacon of freedom" for Latin America, so it has asked Sánchez "a little respect for the history of Spain." His list of reproaches to the socialist candidate has begun by throwing him into face that he feels "contempt" for Galicia, a land that Casado has chosen to make the "central rally" of this campaign, as he himself has said, precisely for this reason, because the socialists "do not win" in this community. However, the PSOE won for the first time in Galicia in the last elections of April, in which the PP was left behind with nine seats. Now, the party hopes to recover the 10N the first position with a deputy plus Pontevedra, another for A Coruña and even one for Ourense, to return to the 12 they had before. In Galician key, Casado has committed the arrival of the AVE to Galicia to the Xacobeo of 2021 and also with the future of the naval sector and with the electro-intensive industry, in front of a Government that believes that it does nothing for this community. Married in this act has been preceded by the president of the Xunta, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, who has sent a clear message to the voters of Citizens and Vox, to whom he has warned that each vote for these parties will only serve to give the Government to Sanchez, which is intended to "divide" the voters.
